think)

p.

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] some favorite movies
messages.msgSnippet: ... He wrote My Dinner with Andre and didn t he also do Vanya on 42nd Street? What else has he done? jocelyn
messages.messageBody:
on 02/17/02 2:29 PM, sjogy@... at sjogy@... wrote:

>
> In a message dated 2/17/02 3:31:03 PM, JVilter@... writes:
>
> << You might know him best as the voice of the T-Rex in the Toy Story movies,
> but he's done tons of other stuff as well:
>>>
>
> He's a brilliant playwright as well.
>
> Paula
He wrote My Dinner with Andre and didn't he also do Vanya on 42nd Street?
What else has he done?

jocelyn

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] some favorite movies

but he's done tons of other stuff as well:

He's a brilliant playwright as well.

Paula

writes::
>
> http://us.imdb.com/Name?Shawn,+Wallace

Thank you! I figured it out - he was Grand Nagus on Star Trek DS9.

I can sleep peacefully tonight..

Dar

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] some favorite movies
messages.msgSnippet: ... You might know him best as the voice of the T-Rex in the Toy Story movies, but he s done tons of other stuff as well:
messages.messageBody:
on 02/17/02 12:08 PM, freeform@... at freeform@... wrote:

> And who is the actor who plays Vizzini? I know I've seen him in soemthing
> else, but I checked the credits and the name didn't ring any bells... any
> ideas?
>
> Dar

You might know him best as the voice of the T-Rex in the Toy Story movies,
but he's done tons of other stuff as well:

http://us.imdb.com/Name?Shawn,+Wallace

jocelyn

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] some favorite movies
messages.msgSnippet: On Sat, 16 Feb 2002 20:47:17 -0800 Jocelyn Vilter  ... I finally so most of that the other night. It was on tv, we turned it on right as Inigo
messages.messageBody:
On Sat, 16 Feb 2002 20:47:17 -0800 Jocelyn Vilter <JVilter@...>
writes:
> I don't think anyone mentioned The Princess Bride

I finally so most of that the other night. It was on tv, we turned it on
right as Inigo and Westley were dueling. Cacie acted out many of the
parts herself, and she handed me a rolled-up shinguard (they're always
around) so that I could act out Inigo's duel with the 6-fingered man with
her...

She also told me ahead of time that the book was different than the
movie, so I didn't freak too loudly at the happy ending part. I liked the
movie, I did, it was not "hollywod-slick". I like the book more, but
that's okay.

And who is the actor who plays Vizzini? I know I've seen him in soemthing
else, but I checked the credits and the name didn't ring any bells... any
ideas?

Dar

messages.messageBody:
>
>Songcatcher (also own the "soundtrack" even though it isn't really from the

Tia

Eleanor Roosevelt

Tia Leschke

On Vancouver Island

messages.subject: some favorite movies
messages.msgSnippet: The Truman Show (soundtrack too) Songcatcher (also own the soundtrack even though it isn t really from the movie, but inspired by it) I don t think anyone
messages.messageBody:
The Truman Show (soundtrack too)

Songcatcher (also own the "soundtrack" even though it isn't really from the
movie, but inspired by it)

I don't think anyone mentioned The Princess Bride

Defending Your Life

The Fifth Element

Ditto on Time Bandits and The Secret of Roan Inish.

Jocelyn
